DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is naming convention followed for Variables?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: 2 Variables (100.0%) are not following the defined standards for naming convention.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to use either upper or lower camel casing to define Variables. For example, IsDataAvailable, of isDataAvailable. Please evaluate all non-compliant cases and update them accordingly. Additionally, you can also view the Variables raw data to conduct qualitative check in terms of meaningfulness.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is naming convention followed for Arguments?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: 2 Argument (50.0%) are not following the defined standards for naming convention
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to define the argument names with a prefix of in_ for input, out_ for output and io_ for input-output type followed by either upper of lower camel casing.  Please evaluate all non-compliant cases and update them accordingly. Additionally, you can also view the Arguments raw data to conduct qualitative check in terms of meaningfulness.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are all writeline activities removed from the Workflow?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No Writeline Activity is defined.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Write line activities are used primarily for debugging purpose and thus it is suggested to remove them from the workflow.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are all message box activities removed from the Workflow?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No MessageBox Activity is defined.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Typically, all message box activities are used primarily for debugging purpose and thus it is suggested to remove them from the workflow. If needed, use Input Dialog activity.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are all Variables used in the code?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: All variables are used and thus this rule is not applicable.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to define only those variables which get used inside the code. All unused variables should be removed from the code. Please remove all unused variables either manually or by using remove unused variable functionality of Ui Path.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are all input Arguments used in the code?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: All Arguments are used.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to use all input arguments inside the code. All unused arguments should be removed from the code. Please remove all unused arguments.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is naming convention followed for the Activities?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: 1 Activity (10.0%) is not following the defined standards for naming convention
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Ideally each and every activity should be uniquely named as display name and should not necessarily be same as that of the Activity Name. Please evaluate all non-compliant cases and update them accordingly.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is Commenting done adequately for all activities?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: Required Comment or Annotation is not provided for 3 container activities 100.0%
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to provide adequate comments at least for each container activity. Please provide comments against each non-compliant cases.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are all unused activities removed from the Workflow?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No Activities are commented out.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to remove all comment out activities as they will not be executed and might be there for debugging purpose. Please remove all such cases.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is the code componentized enough to maintain?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: Optimal number of Activities 10 used in single workflow
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to use not more than 100 activities inside any workflow. Anything beyond this is the indication of poor componentization. Please re-evaluate the design from componentization perspective.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is nested IF logic avoided in the Workflow?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No Nested IF Statement is defined.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to avoid more that one If activities inside any If activity. This creates code complex and unreadable. Please simplify the code by eliminating nested if scenarios.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Unique variable names
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: All Variables have unique names. Thus this rule is not applicable.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Variable names should have unique names if they are in different scopes, but the same workflow file.

DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Variable names should have unique names if they are in different scopes, but the same workflow file.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Variable length exceeded
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: All Variables have character count less than 20. Thus this rule is not applicable.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: The names of variables should not be longer than a set number characters. It is recommended to abbreviate longer words, as they make it difficult to monitor variables during debugging, especially if the first part of the name is the same.

DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: There are no hardcoded URLs in the script.

DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Typically, it is suggested to avoid TerminateWorkflow activity and instead implement the logic of ShouldStop based on the transaction. Please revisit the code and see if this can be avoided.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is browser closed or instance passed as out argument in the workflow?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No Acitivity is defined with Input methods and thus this rule is not applicable.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to close the browser explicitly inside the complete workflow. For individual workflow, if it is not closed there then instance should be passed as out argument to get that closed in the parent workflow. Please update all such cases accordingly.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is nested try-catch logic avoided in the workflow?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to avoid TryCatch block inside TryCatch block. This creates code complex and unreadable. Please simplify the code by eliminating nested TryCatch scenarios.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Argument Default Values
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: 2 Arguments have unused default values
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Make sure the names of existing DataTable arguments start with the argument type and include the dt_ prefix.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Arguments Length Exceeded
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: All Arguments have character count less than 30. Thus this rule is not applicable.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: The names of Arguments should not be longer than a set number characters. It is recommended to abbreviate longer words, as they make it difficult to monitor variables during debugging, especially if the first part of the name is the same.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: High Arguments Count
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: Workflow have an optimal number of Arguments.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: The Workflow should contain a limited number of Arguments.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: File Activities Stats
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: The workflow contains 5 number of Activities in the current workflow.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: This counter gathers stats on used activities per workflow, including the number of activities per each file and branching activities.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is Static delay introduced in the code?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No occurrence(s) of static delay is defined and thus this rule is not applicable.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to avoid static delays and instead use conditional delays. Please revisit all such cases and try to convert all static delays to the conditional one.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is Input mode efficiently used in the Workflow?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to use either simulate or sendWindowMessage input mode, with a priority being given to the simulate mode. Please revisit all default cases and assess if they can be changed to the preferred input modes.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is WaitForReady mode used, efficient enough for Web Applications?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: For all web interactions, it is suggested to not use None as value for WaitForReady property. Please revisit all such cases and assess if this can be changed to other values.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are multiple activities getting executed in parallel mode?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No Acitivity is defined with Input methods and thus this rule is not applicable.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to execute the similar activities in parallel mode. Please revisit all such scenarios and assess if parallel mode can be applied.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is manageable number of activities used in parallel container?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to use not more than 5 activities block in parallel inside the Parallel container. Please simplify the code by eliminating all such cases.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is DelayBetweenKeys property parameterized?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to fill all DelayBetweenKeys properties with configurable parameters to calibrate the BOT in real environment without making any changes in the code. Please update all non-compliant cases.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is Continue On Error functionality used Appropriately?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Typically, it is suggested to avoid ContinueOnError property as True. But there are few scenarios where this is inevitable. Thus, please revisit the code logic and assess all such cases if this property is really required to be true.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is Absolute path preferred over Relative path?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to use relative path instead of absolute path to accomplish flexibility in dealing with changes. Please update all such cases if possible.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Empty Workflow
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: The workflow consists of data to execute.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Make sure to exclude empty files from the project in order to keep only relevant workflows and to reduce the total size of the project.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Project Workflow Count
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: The workflow consists of projects files.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: The Rules lists the number of workflow files by project folder.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Check Project.json Exists
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: The project folder does not contain the required project.json file
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: All projects developed in Studio must have an associated project.json file. If such a file was not found, try reopening the project with Studio and checking it again.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Main Workflow Exists
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: The project.json does not point to Main.xaml to initiate execution.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is recommended to fix the project.json file to point to the entry/main workflow.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Multiple Flowchart Layers
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: The workflow contains optimal number of flowcharts.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is recommended to reduce the number of flowchart layers to a minimum to ensure maintainability and readability.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Empty Sequence
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: 1 number of empty Sequences in the workflow.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Remove empty sequences because they can clutter the workflow.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Deeply Nested Activities
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No Nested Activities Statement is defined.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is usually more difficult to see and understand workflows that have too many deeply nested activities, so it is recommended to avoid deeply nested structures.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Redundant Sequences
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: 1 Sequences in the workflow have low number of activities.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Redundant sequences should not be used since they only make the workflow cluttered.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are passwords stored inside the code?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to not hard code any kind of credentials inside the code, ex:- database, email automation, object cloning. Please updae all non-compliant cases.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is the code vulnerable towards accessing hidden urls in it?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: There are no hardcoded URLs in the script.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to not hardcode any Urls inside the code. Unknown URLs make the BOT vulnerable towards external security threats. Please ensure to either parameterize the URLs or remove them from the code.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Are User Names stored inside the code?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to not store any user names inside the code. Please update all such non-compliant cases and use appropriate approach like assets, configuration file, etc

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is the code vulnerable towards business data getting stored in logs?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: Typically, business data get stored in the system using additional log fields. Please revisit all such cases and evaluate them based on applicable data storage policy. In general, transaction ids are fine to be stored from traceability perspective.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is the code vulnerable towards business data getting shared through hidden email ids in it?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to not hardcode any email id inside the code. It makes the BOT vulnerable towards sharing business data. Please ensure to either parameterize the email ids or remove them from the code.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: Is the code vulnerable towards executing hidden Applications or executable in it?
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: No data is defined in the given input file, therefore this rule is not applicable
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: It is suggested to not hardcode any application executables inside the code. Unknown executables make the BOT vulnerable towards external security threats. Please ensure to either parameterize such cases or remove them from the code.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: SecureString Argument
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: Workflow does not contain any SecureString type arguments.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: The SecureString type should not be used for any purpose other than the intended one. The scope of such variables should be very limited, ideally in the same scope where they were created.

DetailedDashboard.RuleName: SecureString Misusage
DetailedDashboard.ObservationMessages: Workflow does not contain any misused SecureString type arguments.
DetailedDashboard.Suggestion: The SecureString type should not be used for any purpose other than the intended one. The scope of such variables should be very limited, ideally in the same scope where they were created.
